{"id":887483432,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"4Â months","timestamp":1674999489,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"6 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/887483432/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"String to Integer (atoi)","memory":"7.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n  int myAtoi(string s) {\n      \n    const int len = s.size();\n\n    if(len == 0){\n        return 0;\n    }\n\n    int index = 0;\n\n    // skipping white spaces\n    while(index < len && s[index] == ' '){\n        ++index;\n    }\n\n    // to handle sign cases\n    bool isNegative = false;\n\n    if(index < len){\n\n      if(s[index] == '-'){\n        isNegative = true;\n        ++index;\n      } else if (s[index] == '+'){\n          ++index;\n      }\n\n    }\n\n    int result = 0;\n\n    // converting digit(in character form) to integer form\n    // iterate until non-digit character is not found or we can say iterate till found character is a digit\n    while(index < len && isDigit(s[index])){\n\n      /* s[index] - '0' is to convert the char digit into int digit eg: '5' - '0' --> 5\n      or else it will store the ASCII value of 5 i.e. 53,\n      so we do 53(ASCII of 5) - 48(ASCII of 0(zero)) to get 5 as int*/\n      int digit = s[index] - '0';\n\n      // to avoid integer overflow\n      if(result > (INT_MAX / 10) || (result == (INT_MAX / 10) && digit > 7)){\n          return isNegative ? INT_MIN : INT_MAX;\n      }\n\n      result = (result * 10) + digit; // adding digits at their desired place-value\n\n      ++index;\n    }\n      \n    return isNegative ? -result : result;\n  }\n    \nprivate:\n  bool isDigit(char ch){\n    return ch >= '0' && ch <= '9';\n  }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"string-to-integer-atoi","has_notes":false}
